entry.title: Integrating BM25 in Hybrid Search and Reranking Pipelines: Strategies and Applications
entry.summary:
Integrating BM25 in Hybrid Search and Reranking Pipelines: Strategies and Applications
BM25 (Best Matching 25) is a foundational algorithm in information retrieval, renowned for its efficiency in keyword-based relevance scoring. While modern neural rerankers and vector search dominate advanced retrieval systems, BM25 remains a critical component in hybrid architectures and reranking workflows. This report examines BM25â€™s dual role in hybrid search systems and reranking pipelines, analyzing implementation patterns, use cases, and technical considerations. Hybrid search combines keyword-based retrieval (BM25) with semantic vector search to balance precision and recall. BM25â€™s role here is to ensure exact keyword matches and term rarity are prioritized, while vector search captures contextuâ€¦

entry.title: Printed Invoice Misaligned Compared to Print Preview â€“ How to Fix?
entry.summary: Hi developers, I'm working on a web-based invoice application (Angular/HTML/CSS based), and I have an issue during printing: ðŸ–¨ï¸ Problem: The print preview shows the invoice perfectly aligned with correct fonts, layout, and spacing. But when I actually print it, the alignment is off, some text overflows or gets clipped, and occasionally the ink prints unevenly (bold/faint). ðŸŽ¯ My Setup: Printed from Google Chrome (latest) HTML/CSS-based invoice template Using @media print CSS rules for styling the print view âœ… What I've Tried: Adjusted page margins using CSS Set @page size and margins Checked printer settings (A4, scaling: 100%, margin: none) Disabled headers/footers in print dialog Tested on different printers and browsers â“ What I want to know: What are the common causes of mismatch between print preview and printed output? Are there any best practices for ensuring consistent print layouts in HTML? Is this a CSS/HTML issue, printer driver issue, or browser-related? Any help or resources would be appreciated! Thanks ðŸ™

entry.title: Mastering No-Code/Low-Code: Building Enterprise-Grade Solutions
entry.summary: The landscape of software development is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by the emergence and maturation of no-code and low-code platforms. While often lauded for their simplicity and speed, these tools are increasingly proving their mettle in the complex world of enterprise-grade solutions. Moving beyond the initial hype, organizations are now exploring how to master these platforms for robust, scalable, and secure applications that truly drive business value. No-code and low-code platforms offer undeniable benefits: accelerated development cycles, significant cost reductions, and the empowerment of "citizen developers" â€“ business users who can build applications without extensive coding knowledge. Gartner predicts that low-code development tools will account for 75% of new aâ€¦

entry.summary: The age of software that simply waits for user input is fading. Weâ€™re now entering an era where digital systems can think, act, and learnâ€”autonomously. These are not mere programs or models. They are AI agents: intelligent entities capable of taking initiative, using tools, remembering information, and solving problems in open-ended environments. For developers, the implications are profound. AI agents represent a shift from writing static applications to engineering dynamic systems that simulate human-like decision-making. This blog post explores how AI agents are redefining software development: what they are, how they work, what tools enable them, and why theyâ€™re central to the future of digital systems. What Is an AI Agent? At the core, an AI agent is a system that can: Perceive its enâ€¦

entry.title: Mastering Lists in Python: A Comprehensive Guide
entry.summary:
The Foundation of Python: Lists Lists are a fundamental data structure in Python, allowing you to store and manipulate collections of items. Let's dive into the world of Python lists and uncover their versatility and power. Creating Lists To create a list in Python, simply enclose your elements within square brackets []: my_list = [1, 2, 3, 'a', 'b', 'c'] Accessing and Slicing You can access individual elements or slices of a list using indexing. Remember, Python uses 0-based indexing: print(my_list[0]) # Output: 1
Manipulating Lists Lists support various operations like appending, extending, inserting, and removing elements: my_list.append(4)
List Comprehensions List comprehensions offer a concise way to create lists based on existing lists: squared_numbers = [x**2 for x in range(5)] Advanced Techniques Explore advanced list operations like sorting, reversing, and using lambda functions with built-in functions such as sort() and filter(). Common Pitfalls Beware of mutable vs. immutable behavior when working with lists, and watch out for unintended side effects when modifying lists. Conclusion Python lists are a powerful tool for handling collections of data efficiently. By mastering lists and their operations, you can write more concise and effective code in Python.

entry.title: A Guide to Phishing Websites and Malicious Link Checkers
entry.summary:
Phishing websites impersonate legitimate platformsâ€”like banks, e-commerce sites, or social networksâ€”to trick users into revealing sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, or credit card numbers. Common tactics include: URL Spoofing: Slight changes in spelling (e.g., bank0famerica.com vs bankofamerica.com) to mislead users.
Fake HTTPS: Even though the website may display a lock icon and start with https://, attackers can use free SSL certificates to fake legitimacy.
Social Engineering: Attackers distribute malicious links via email, SMS, or social media, enticing users to click. Credential Theft: Login information entered into fake websites can be immediately stolen and misused.
Malware Infection: Clicking malicious links may download ransomware, trojans, or spyware to yoâ€¦

entry.title: How DEX Development Works
entry.summary: How DEX Development Works Choosing the Blockchain: Select a blockchain network (like Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, or Solana) that supports smart contracts and aligns with your scalability and transaction speed needs. Smart Contract Development: Write the core smart contracts that handle order matching, fund custody, and trade execution.Blockchain explorers let users verify transaction information. Frontend Development: Design and develop an intuitive user interface that allows users to connect their wallets, place orders, and track transactions easily. Security Auditing: To find and address vulnerabilities, do comprehensive audits of smart contracts. Security is critical to protect usersâ€™ funds and build trust. Testing and Deployment: Test the platform extensively on testnets before launâ€¦
